alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 2:45PM MDT until May 28 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Yampa River near Maybell affecting Moffat County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt the snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Yampa River near Maybell. * WHEN...Until Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the Yampa River reaches bankfull in spots which would result in minor flooding of low-lying agricultural land and some bank erosion. At 11.0 feet, the boat ramp in the Maybell Bridge Campground/Yampa River Access Point becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:15 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above bankfull tomorrow afternoon, and remain above bankfull through the weekend with a maximum rise of 10.2 feet Saturday evening. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
